description: From translingual Cephalosporium (now Acremonium), a genus of fungi, + -in.

entries.meaning: Any of a class of natural and synthetic antibiotics developed from Acremonium fungi, having a cepham structure.
examples: Another important group of antibiotics, the cephalosporins, a class that includes more than twenty-five different drugs, are chemically distinct from the penicillins but act in the same way as cell wall inhibitors, as do vancomycin and bacitracin.
